net.sourceforge.metrics.core.sources
Class Dispatcher

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--net.sourceforge.metrics.core.sources.Dispatcher
public class Dispatcher
extends java.lang.Object

Based on the current selection figure out what metric source to create and instruct to calculate metrics, or simply pick up from the cache and use it.

Author:
Frank Sauer

calculateAbstractMetricSource

public static AbstractMetricSource calculateAbstractMetricSource(org.eclipse.jdt.core.IJavaElement input,
                                                                 AbstractMetricSource parent,
                                                                 java.util.Map data)
Get the AbstractMetricSource for the given IJavaElement from cache or create a new one and have it calculate the metrics. This method will give the parent AbstractMetricSource a chance to initialize the new element (in cas e anew one is created) with the given data.
Parameters:
input -  
parent - AbstractMetricSource with need to participate in creation process
data - Map with additional data needed for creation
Returns:
AbstractMetricSource
See Also:
AbstractMetricSource.initializeNewInstance(AbstractMetricSource,IJavaElement,Map)

getSourceMap

protected java.util.Map getSourceMap()

isCurrent

protected static boolean isCurrent(AbstractMetricSource ms)
Determines whether the given AbstractMetricSource (obtained from storage) is current with respect to the modification timestamp of the underlying resource. If it is not, remove the entry from storage and return false, otherwise return true.
Parameters:
ms -  
Returns:
boolean
